definition[0]: to complete the last part of something that you are doing
example[0]: It’ll take me a couple of hours to finish this job off.
definition[1]: to use or eat all of something, so there is none left
definition[2]: to complete an event, performance, piece of work etc by doing one final thing
example[2]: We’ll finish off with a track from Adam’s new album.
example[3]: She finished off her speech by thanking her sponsors.
example[4]: Finish off by cleaning the monitor and the keyboard.
note[1]: finish off/finish something ↔ off by doing something
definition[3]: to kill a person or animal when they are already weak or wounded
definition[4]: to take away all of someone’s strength, energy etc
example[5]: The walk up the hill really finished me off.
